Description:
Detects execution of a browser process with a URL argument pointing to a file with a potentially interesting extension. This can be abused to download arbitrary files or to hide from the user for example by launching the browser in a minimized state.

Author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: File Download From Browser Process Via Inline URL
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((command like '%.7z' or command like '%.dat' or command like '%.dll' or command like '%.exe' or command like '%.hta' or command like '%.ps1' or command like '%.psm1' or command like '%.txt' or command like '%.vbe' or command like '%.vbs' or command like '%.zip') and (process_path like '%\brave.exe' or process_path like '%\chrome.exe' or process_path like '%\msedge.exe' or process_path like '%\opera.exe' or process_path like '%\vivaldi.exe') and command like '%http%')
